author: chefkaspa
title: Something different
review:
Remark: I got the set pre-assembled and therefore do not discuss or rate the building process. I kept the rating of Building Experience at its default (3).

Hovercraft

Feature list:

  • Running on wheels
  • Steering, also changes orientation of propulsion fans
  • Propulsions fans driven from wheels
  • Lowering + Raise of loading ramp
  • Loading tool ("crane") by means of a toothed rack (up/down)
  • Bridge slides left/right for operation of the "crane"

The fans are rather wobbly turning left-right when the ship is pushed forward. Turning the steering knob will temporarily adjust their orientation.

Truck

The truck features steering, suspension and has a freight box that can be handled by any crane that connects with a technic (pin) hole.

On the inside, you'll find a colourful set of pieces including red, white, blue and, inevitably, also a single brown part. This is rather different from 42062 that shows clean use of colours.

Summary

The overall length of the ship (ramp lowered) is similar, the width only 2/3 of the size of the box. Colour palette is nice.

Features and playability is comparable to last years Ocean Explorer. You will need a flat surface to push the ship.
The container truck from 42062 just fits onto the deck if you move the bridge to left or right.

It would have been nice if intakes for air cushion also had been connected to the wheels for rotation.
